alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 27 at 2:09AM PDT until March 28 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM PDT TUESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, south winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...In the Warning area, Interstate 5 from Grenada south to Weed. In the Advisory area, the city of Montague and portions of Interstate 5 just north of Grenada. * WHEN...From 2 PM Monday to 8 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are expected to be strongest Monday night into Tuesday afternoon. Also snow in combination with winds will result in reduced visibility and periods of whiteout conditions especially in the southern Shasta Valley near Weed beginning early this evening and continuing into Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
